title: Encourage Adoption in Universities
description: 人々は、ブームになっているものを追いかける傾向があります。私たちはすでに、暗号通貨では多くの成功を聞きましたが、スマートコントラクトの作成ではほとんど聞きませんでした。

f6_assessments.q0: This is an idea that could be be great, however, the proposal has no concrete plan on how to achieve it. Is this going to be hackathons, student organisations, actual university courses? Which universities, which countries, who is going to organise it etc.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately no plan has been provided. Please provide a plan on what content you would deliver , where and to whom and how you would market it. This should be combined with a detailed budget with timelines and milestones.
f6_assessments.q2: As no actual plan has been provided it is not possible to audit progress or success of this proposal. Please include timelines and deliverable against which progress could be measured and produce some metrics for success. How many student in how many institutions using how many languages do you intend to reach. How will their engagement be measured?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer was not very clear in his problem statement. The solution is to encourage university students to study and spread the benefits of smart contract. The proposer does not present any key metrics or objectives for evaluating the impact of the proposal. It was also not discussed how the financial sustainability of the project would be in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not present any evidence of his abilities. It also does not show how many people are involved in implementing the proposal. The budget is not detailed so it is not possible to assess whether it is reasonable. The proposal does not have any implementation guidance plan that shows what will be done and how, therefore it does not describe the resources needed to implement the work. The proposal does not appear to pose any relevant risk
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer does not present milestones, KPIs or key metrics or deadline for completion of the proposal. These points are important for evaluating a proposal, next time I suggest you present a conductive plan, a roadmap and key metrics
